data.text: Even with the best shoe covers, Shoes will always get wet on the inside because your sock will wick water down your foot. Best advices, grocery bag between your sock and shoe, run the bag up your leg and tuck the end into your sock. Take off shoes as soon as it stops raining, assuming you have a second pair which you should, and pack tightly with newspaper and hang on the outside of your bag to air dry. Newspaper will pull water through the shoe faster then towels and you can throw it out when your done. Happy riding.

data.text: I am having a great experience with Vivobarefoot Tracker 2. They are very comfortable, they become fully waterproof if you use shoe vaseline on them. They lack the security of a Meindl , La Sportiva or Mammut, but they give plenty in ease of wear on the long road. This is the second year I am wearing them and besides some scratches , they are behaving very well. Before I was a bikepacker I used to be a mountaineer& backpacker so I am very finnicky with what I walk in.
